subject: Web3
title: Beeple's $69 Million Sale
description: A quick, practical guide to Beeple's $69 Million Sale.

hook.text: In March 2021, a digital artist named Beeple sold an NFT at Christie's auction house for $69.3 million.

buildup.text: The piece, 'Everydays,' was a collage of 5,000 daily artworks Beeple had created over 13 years.

discovery.text: It was the third-highest price ever paid for a living artist's work. The buyer was a crypto investor named MetaKovan.

twist.text: MetaKovan then fractionalized the NFT into tokens and sold shares. He turned art into a financial instrument.

climax.text: The sale put NFTs on every news channel. Overnight, digital art went from obscure to headline news.

punchline.text: A JPEG sold for $69 million and changed the art world forever.

quiz.question: How much did Beeple's NFT sell for at Christie's?
